segment.source: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11)
segment.target: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11)

segment.source: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11)
segment.target: Choose how to install Internet Explorer 11 (IE11)

segment.source: Before you install Internet Explorer 11, you should:
segment.target: Before you install Internet Explorer 11, you should:

segment.source: Decide if your Group Policy Objects should migrate to the new version.
segment.target: Decide if your Group Policy Objects should migrate to the new version.

segment.source: Check vendor support for updated functionality.
segment.target: Check vendor support for updated functionality.

segment.source: Check whether third-party vendors have new versions or updates to necessary add-ons, apps, or code libraries.
segment.target: Check whether third-party vendors have new versions or updates to necessary add-ons, apps, or code libraries.

segment.source: Choose the right version of Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Choose the right version of Internet Explorer.

segment.source: IE11 comes pre-installed on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 or you can download it for Windows 7 SP1 or Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1) from the Internet Explorer Downloads site.
segment.target: IE11 comes pre-installed on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 or you can download it for Windows 7 SP1 or Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1) from the Internet Explorer Downloads site.

segment.source: Choose how you'll deploy your installation package.
segment.target: Choose how you'll deploy your installation package.

segment.source: Your deployment method should be based on whether you're installing to computers already running Windows, or if you're deploying IE11 as part of a Windows installation.
segment.target: Your deployment method should be based on whether you're installing to computers already running Windows, or if you're deploying IE11 as part of a Windows installation.

segment.source: Use System Center R2 2012 System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, System Center Essentials 2010, Windows Server Updates Services (WSUS), or Microsoft Intune to deploy IE11.
segment.target: Use System Center R2 2012 System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, System Center Essentials 2010, Windows Server Updates Services (WSUS), or Microsoft Intune to deploy IE11.

segment.source: For more information about how to use these systems, see System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, System Center Essentials 2010, Windows Server Update Services, and Microsoft Intune Overview.
segment.target: For more information about how to use these systems, see System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager, System Center Essentials 2010, Windows Server Update Services, and Microsoft Intune Overview.

segment.source: As part of a Windows deployment.
segment.target: As part of a Windows deployment.

segment.source: Update your Windows images to include IE11, and then add the update to your MDT deployment share or to your Windows image.
segment.target: Update your Windows images to include IE11, and then add the update to your MDT deployment share or to your Windows image.

segment.source: For instructions about how to create and use Windows images, see Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM.
segment.target: For instructions about how to create and use Windows images, see Create and Manage a Windows Image Using DISM.

segment.source: For general information about deploying IE, see Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), Windows ADK Overview.
segment.target: For general information about deploying IE, see Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT), Windows ADK Overview.
